The claim originated from Facebook posts: 2. Several police departments in the United States shared the claim on Facebook to remind their communities about locking car doors, even though it does not apply to Churchill.
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police: RCMP) confirmed that there is no current law in Churchill that prohibits residents from locking their car doors.
While there is no legal requirement: it is a common practice in Churchill to leave car doors unlocked due to the potential threat of polar bears and the town's remote location.
